channel.title: CVE Feed for ThemeFusion -- Fusion Builder
channel.description: The latest CVEs for ThemeFusion -- Fusion Builder

item.title: CVE-2024-5628|2024-09-13T14:01:29.018Z -- themefusion -- fusion%20builder
item.description: The Avada | Website Builder For WordPress & eCommerce plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the plugin's fusion_button shortcode in all versions up to, and including, 3.11.9 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping on user supplied attributes. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with contributor-level access and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page. NOTE: This vulnerability was partially fixed in 3.11.9. Additional hardening for alternate attack vectors was added to version 3.11.10.

item.title: CVE-2023-39311|2024-08-27T20:40:10.785Z -- themefusion -- fusion%20builder
item.description: Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) vulnerability in ThemeFusion Fusion Builder.This issue affects Fusion Builder: from n/a through 3.11.1.

item.title: CVE-2023-39310|2024-08-02T18:02:06.801Z -- themefusion -- fusion%20builder
item.description: Missing Authorization vulnerability in ThemeFusion Fusion Builder.This issue affects Fusion Builder: from n/a through 3.11.1.

item.title: CVE-2023-39306|2024-08-02T18:02:06.819Z -- themefusion -- fusion%20builder
item.description: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting') vulnerability in ThemeFusion Fusion Builder allows Reflected XSS.This issue affects Fusion Builder: from n/a through 3.11.1.

item.title: CVE-2023-39309|2024-08-02T18:02:06.918Z -- themefusion -- fusion%20builder
item.description: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an SQL Command ('SQL Injection') vulnerability in ThemeFusion Fusion Builder.This issue affects Fusion Builder: from n/a through 3.11.1.

item.title: CVE-2024-5628|2024-09-13T05:30:55.590Z -- themefusion -- fusion%20builder
item.description: The Avada | Website Builder For WordPress & eCommerce plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the plugin's fusion_button shortcode in all versions up to, and including, 3.11.9 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping on user supplied attributes. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with contributor-level access and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page. NOTE: This vulnerability was partially fixed in 3.11.9. Additional hardening for alternate attack vectors was added to version 3.11.10.
